title: Position time graph from description of motion

content.question: A cart is moving in the +x-direction and passes the origin when time t=0. The cart then moves with decreasing speed, stops, and moves in the â€“x-direction with increasing speed. Which of the following graphs best represents the cart's position x as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. There are no numbers indicated along either axis. The curve is a concave down parabola that begins at the origin, and extends upward and to the right until it reaches its maximum. The curve then extends downward and to the right until it ends on horizontal axis, far to the right of the origin.

The figure presents the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. There are no numbers indicated along either axis. The straight line begins at the origin and extends upward and to the right until it ends.

The figure presents the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. There are no numbers indicated along either axis. The straight line begins on the vertical axis, above the origin, and extends downward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis, and ends in the quadrant 4.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. There are no numbers indicated along either axis. The curve is an concave up parabola that begins on the vertical axis high above the origin, and extends downward and to the right until it reaches its minimum at a point on the horizontal axis. The curve then extends upward and to the right until it ends high above the horizontal axis.

The figure presents the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. There are no numbers indicated along either axis. The line begins on the vertical axis below the origin, and extends straight horizontally to the right until it ends.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. There are no numbers indicated along either axis. The curve is a concave down parabola that begins at the origin, and extends upward and to the right until it reaches its maximum. The curve then extends downward and to the right until it ends on horizontal axis, far to the right of the origin.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
